encodingDesc.p: The original encoding was done in plain text files following the encoding quidelines of the Morgenländische Gesellschaft. With a dedicated web application these plain text files were transformed into XML documents validating (partially) against the Epidoc-Schema and those XML-Documents have been further sematically annotaded.
In order to avoid well known xml-issues especially in regards of overlapping elements the actual edited/annotated text was multiplied in several anonymos blocks, each block providing specific markup.

bin Shahr, ruler of Qatabān and the chil-
ʿAmm and of ʾAwsān and of Kaḥid and
and of Tubanū and of Yarfaʾ, the southern lands
has excavated and smoothed and opened up the road
Ẓarim at the command of ʿAmm Dhū-Shaqīr-by ʿAmm and by
by ʿAmm Dhū-Raymat and by ʿAmm Dhū-Shaqīr and by
by Dhāt-Ṣanatim and by Dhāt-Ẓahirān and by Dhāt-Raḥībān.
Restored full text of the inscription:
Yadaʿʾab Dhubyān
bin Shahr, ruler of Qatabān and the chil-
dren of ʿAmm and of ʾAwsān and of Kaḥid and of Da-
hasum and of Tubanū and of Yarfaʾ, the southern lands
and the northern, has excavated and smoothed and opened up the road
and pass of Ẓarim at the command of ʿAmm Dhū-Shaqīr-by ʿAmm and by
ʾAnbay and by ʿAmm Dhū-Raymat and by ʿAmm Dhū-Shaqīr and by
Ḥawkam and by Dhāt-Ṣanatim and by Dhāt-Ẓahirān and by Dhāt-Raḥībān.
ʾAwsʿamm bin Yiṣūrʿamm of the lineage of Madahum led and directed all of
the cutting and smoothing and paving of the pass of Ẓarim at the directive of his lord,
Yadaʿʾab.
